ai.summary: A short, easy coastal walk to Foula North End covering about 4.1 km. The route follows a seaside path with open views, suitable for beginners and families with sturdy footwear. Expect exposed sections and variable conditions, so plan for wind and rain.
ai.terrain_summary: Coastal path along cliffs and shoreline; mostly compact dirt and gravel, with some muddy sections after rain. Expect exposed, windy conditions and potential uneven ground near headlands; some sections may be narrow or eroded.
ai.safety_notes: Check local weather and daylight; Foula is remote with limited services. Wear weather-appropriate clothing and sturdy footwear. Plan for strong winds and sudden changes in visibility; stay on marked paths and away from cliff edges. Bring a map or GPS, inform someone of your itinerary, and carry a small first aid kit and a whistle in case of emergency.
recommended_gear: Sturdy waterproof hiking boots with good grip
Hat and gloves (wind can be strong)
Fully charged phone with power bank
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly May–Sept).

seo.title: Foula North End Hike – Easy 4.1 km Coastal Walk in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the easy 4.1 km Foula North End coastal hike. Practical tips on terrain, safety, and gear for a windy UK coastal walk.
